Package a4

Class Heap<E,​P>

  • java.lang.Object
    • a4.Heap<E,​P>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - element
    P - priority
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    PriorityQueue<E,​P>
    public class Heap<E,​P>
extends java.lang.Object
implements PriorityQueue<E,​P>
    The Heap is a specialized binary tree-based data structure. In this particular heap, each element E is associated with a priority P. Priority is considered higher-to-lower according to its comparator: for example, for a typical numeric order integer comparator, an item with priority of 2 comes before an item of priority 1.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Heap​(java.util.Comparator<P> c)
      The constructor creates an empty heap with the given comparator.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(E e, P p)
      Add the element e with priority p to this.
      void changePriority​(E e, P p)
      Change the priority associated with e to p.
      java.util.Comparator<? super P> comparator()
      Return the comparator used for ordering priorities
      E peek()
      Return the largest element of this, according to comparator().
      E poll()
      Remove and return the largest element of this, according to comparator() Runs in O(log n) time.
      int size()
      Return the number of elements in this.

      • add

        public void add​(E e,
                P p)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add the element e with priority p to this. Runs in O(log n + a) time, where a is the time it takes to append an element to an ArrayList of size n.
        Specified by:
        add in interface PriorityQueue<E,​P>
        Throws:
